comments:
Build ID: M20060921-0945 & RAD 7

Steps To Reproduce:
In RAD7.0 there's a tool called WebsiteNavigator which is enabled through the WebSiteNavigation facet. I enabled this facet while creating a Static Web Project. Enabling this feature added a nature WebSiteNature in the .project file. After that if i try to convert the static web project to a Dynamic Web Project, the conversion fails due to the fact that WebSiteNature is dependent nature of ModuleCoreNature as shown in the snippet below. 

 <extension
         id="WebSiteNature"
         name="WebSite Nature"
         point="org.eclipse.core.resources.natures">
      <runtime>
         <run class="com.ibm.etools.siteedit.nature.WebSiteNatureRuntime" />
      </runtime>
      <requires-nature id="org.eclipse.wst.common.modulecore.ModuleCoreNature">
      </requires-nature>
      <builder id="com.ibm.etools.siteedit.SiteUpdateBuilder" />
      <builder id="com.ibm.etools.siteedit.SiteNavBuilder" />
   </extension>


I went through the code of the class that tries to Convert the Static to Dynamic Web Project. There i found that the Eclipse code tries to uninstall the ModuleCoreNature which is unsuccessfull as it has a dependent nature WebSiteNature. 
In the execute method of class org.eclipse.wst.project.facet.SimpleWebFacetUninstallDelegate we have 
ProjectUtilities.removeNatureFromProject(project, "org.eclipse.wst.common.modulecore.ModuleCoreNature").

I then tried to implement a uninstall delegate for WebSiteNavigation(which removes the WebSiteNature) for the Website facet but the problem here is that it the code control never reaches to the uninstal delegate. So in order to overcome this i first go and uninstall the facet(this calls my uninstall delegate) and then perform the conversion. But as a user i would not like to or i may not be knowing these steps. Eclipse is not automatically determining that a dependent nature exists and hence the problem arises. 

The Steps to reproduce are in RAD 7:
1) Create a Static Web Project.
2) Choose the facet WebSiteNavigation.
3) Right click the Project in Project Explorer and choose Static Web Project --> Convert to Dynamic WebProject --> Choose version as 2.3. 
4) Hit Ok.
This results in a exception(given below), the cause of which is already explained above.
